books.author: by Stacey Abrams
books.description: When Justice Wynn slips into a coma, his law clerk, Avery Keene, must unravel the clues of a controversial case.
books.name: WHILE JUSTICE SLEEPS

books.author: by John Grisham
books.description: Samuel Sooleymon receives a basketball scholarship to North Carolina Central and determines to bring his family over from a civil war-ravaged South Sudan.
books.name: SOOLEY

books.author: by Laura Dave
books.description: Hannah Hall discovers truths about her missing husband and bonds with his daughter from a previous relationship.
books.name: THE LAST THING HE TOLD ME

books.author: by Jennifer Weiner
books.description: Daisy Shoemaker receives emails intended for a woman leading a more glamorous life and finds there was more to this accident.
books.name: THAT SUMMER

books.author: by Emily Henry
books.description: Opposites Poppy and Alex meet to vacation together one more time in hopes of saving their relationship.
books.name: PEOPLE WE MEET ON VACATION

books.author: by James Patterson and Maxine Paetro
books.description: The 21st book in the Women’s Murder Club series. New evidence changes the investigation of a missing mother.
books.name: 21ST BIRTHDAY

books.author: by Andy Weir
books.description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.
books.name: PROJECT HAIL MARY

books.author: by Delia Owens
books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.
books.name: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING

books.author: by David Baldacci
books.description: Aloysius Archer, a World War II veteran, seeks to apprentice with Willie Dash, a private eye, in a corrupt California town.
books.name: A GAMBLING MAN

books.author: by Kristin Hannah
books.description: As dust storms roll during the Great Depression, Elsa must choose between saving the family and farm or heading West.
books.name: THE FOUR WINDS

books.author: by Matt Haig
books.description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.
books.name: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY

books.author: by Amanda Gorman
books.description: The poem read on President Joe Biden's Inauguration Day, by the youngest poet to write and perform an inaugural poem.
books.name: THE HILL WE CLIMB

books.author: by Mary Alice Monroe
books.description: The seventh book in the Beach House series. A love triangle is complicated by Covid-19.
books.name: THE SUMMER OF LOST AND FOUND

books.author: by Alex Michaelides
books.description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.
books.name: THE SILENT PATIENT

books.author: by Jake Tapper
books.description: The second book in the Charlie and Margaret Marder Mystery series. Attorney General Robert Kennedy asks the Marders to look into a threat, which brings them into contact with the Rat Pack and the Church of Scientology.
books.name: THE DEVIL MAY DANCE
